channel.title: Subprocess.popen on purpleidea.com
channel.description: Recent content in Subprocess.popen on purpleidea.com

item.title: the python subprocess module
item.description: i’m sure that i won’t be able to tell you anything revolutionary which can’t be found out by reading the manual, but i thought i would clarify it, and by showing you a specific example which i needed. subprocess.Popen accepts a bunch or args, one of which is the shell argument, which is False by default. If you specify shell=True then the first argument of popen should be a string which is what gets parsed by the shell and then eventually run.
